title: What can I do if there is no location information on pictures that I take?
answer:
1. Check whether GPS is on. Go to Settings > Location access > Location mode and choose High accuracy or Battery saving to use your network connection to help determine the location. Do not select Device only.

1. In the camera app's settings, enable the location service. In the gallery appâ€™s settings, enable show location taken.

1. You need to be connected to mobile data or a Wi-Fi network to geo-tag photos.

1. Try taking pictures outside in an open area.

1. Some phones do not support showing location information in the lower right corner of the photo. Please touch the picture to see the detailed information and check whether there is latitude and longitude information there.

1. When taking pictures, the notification bar will show Searching for GPS. Continue taking photos until the notification bar displays a message indicating that GPS location has been determined.
